p: In a prospective study conducted in Athens on children with hematological malignancies (65% of cases) or solid tumors who had received chemotherapy or HSCT treatment, the viral genome was isolated in 38.4% of subjects with URTI or LRTI infections, both febrile and nonfebrile. RSV was the most frequently isolated virus (46% of cases) followed by parainfluenza virus and bocavirus, identified in approximately 13% of children. Approximately 40% of children tested positive for a viral agent had a diagnosis of ALL, 11% of AML and 1% of lymphoma, respectively [ 1].
